name: Presidential Birthplaces Quiz | Presidential Deaths | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first president to be born under the United States flag?
questions.explanation:
Martin Van Buren.

	Martin Van Buren was born in 1782. The Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776.

questions.text: Up to and including the 44th President (Barack Obama), which US state could claim to be the birthplace of the most presidents?
questions.explanation:
Virginia.

	George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, James Madison, James Monroe, William Henry Harrison, John Tyler, Zachary Taylor, and Woodrow Wilson were all born in Virginia - eight in total.  Ohio comes second, with seven - Ulysses S. Grant, Rutherford B. Hayes, James A. Garfield, Benjamin Harrison, William McKinley, William Howard Taft, and Warren G. Harding. Ohio sometimes claims Harrison as one of their presidents, since he later settled there, but he was clearly born in Virginia.

questions.text: Who was the only president to be born in Illinois?
Which of these presidents was born in Kentucky?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln.

	Jefferson Davis was also born in Kentucky. He was an American president, Confederate, not Union. Thanks to gjohnson for this information.

questions.text: Which of the following presidents was born in Nebraska?
questions.explanation:
Gerald Ford.

	Gerald Ford succeeded the first president ever to resign.

questions.text: Which of the following was not born in Virginia?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Johnson.

	Andrew Johnson was born in Raleigh, North Carolina.

James Buchanan.

	James Buchanan was the only president who never married.
